page.title: 16HINXWORTH:HOUSING & ENERGY
page.content: HOUSING.The survey area is lightly populated by a highly varied housing stock. Some houses are several hundred years old, others are less than fif- teen. Most have been built individual- ly, with just a few rows of identical farm cottages and local authority houses and even some of these are privately owned. The majority of the houses are stone or brick built with three bedrooms, all have kitchens and bathrooms and many have garages too. All houses have gardens of good size. ENERGY.Homes and farms in the area now take electricity for granted and it is used for everything from lighting to cooking and heating since there is no gas.Some homes use oil, coal, wood or bottled gas particularly for heating since electricity is rather expensive. Some people still possess the old Agas which use oil or wood for cooking on.
